'https://ssl' : 'http://www') + '.google-analytics.com/ga.js'; var s = document.getElementsByTagName('script')[0]; s.parentNode.insertBefore(ga, s); })();

div.p:
Governor Wolf has closed all schools for the remainder of the academic year. Although not the news we wanted to hear, our staff has been preparing for this possibility. As a district, we must continue to move forward to meet the needs of our students, families, and community in as many ways possible. We have committed ourselves to getting even stronger and better during this difficult time. Let us all come together in order to make the remainder of this school year the best it can be. To the Class of 2020, we think of you especially. You have been a tremendous group of leaders this year. We will do everything we possibly can to show our appreciation to you. Black Knight Pride lives on!!!
I have include a link to some inspirational words of encouragement from Governor Wolf

img.alt: PA Schools are closed until further notice

div.div: Pennsylvania schools are closed to reduce the spread of the COVID-19 virus for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year.
Follow the Read More link below to find more information on the virus as well as educational resources students may use at home.
Please follow our Facebook page to receive our most current updates.

Governor Wolf has closed all schools for the remainder of the academic year. Although not the news we wanted to hear, our staff has been preparing for this possibility. As a district, we must continue to move forward to meet the needs of our students, families, and community in as many ways possible. We have committed ourselves to getting even stronger and better during this difficult time. Let us all come together in order to make the remainder of this school year the best it can be. To the Class of 2020, we think of you especially. You have been a tremendous group of leaders this year. We will do everything we possibly can to show our appreciation to you. Black Knight Pride lives on!!!
I have include a link to some inspirational words of encouragement from Governor Wolf

For the health and safety of individuals, the Towanda Area School District Board of Education will be meeting virtually for the month of April, 2020. The next meeting, a regular session, will be held for general purposes on Monday, April 20, 2020, at 7:00 PM. If you wish to join this meeting you may register by clicking on this link: https://zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_vD4QHAWrRAOBQwxIskbcPw If you require reasonable accommodations to access this meeting due to a disability, please contact Cheryl Vaughn at 570-265-9894 or cvaughn@tsd.k12.pa.us prior to the meeting with a request for such accommodations.

h3.a: Drive-up Wi-Fi Access for Student Devices

div.div: Students without sufficient internet access at home can connect to the TASD network in several locations on the school grounds from the safety of a vehicle. The parking lots at J. Andrew Morrow, TAES, and the auditorium-side lot at the High School provide strong signals. Any district-provided device will have access to the Knights-Devices network to send or receive information. Visitors may use whichever location is most convenient. Please avoid using TAES before 11:00 AM due to our food delivery program.
